body.name: Dragon Touch Tablet 10 inch with 32 GB Storage, Android Tablet, Quad Core Processor, IPS HD Display, 8MP Camera, GPS, FM, 2.4Ghz & 5G WiFi with Micro HDMI Port - Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 5 hrs 22 mins
features: [Strong and Powerful Performance]: Do what you like to do, NotePad K10 Tablet features a powerful and strong 64-bit quad-core processor up to 1.3GHz with 2GB RAM, thus delivering quicker app launches, much smoother gameplay experience.

[Native and Android OS]: The NotePad K10 Tablet has been certified from GMS and features with the Android System. Getting rid of unexpected ads and having full access to Google Play, it’s smarter, faster and better close to you.

[Better Display Wonderful Contents]: With a wide and stunning 800*1280 IPS display, which presents a bright display with more abundant colors and more delicate picture quality from all angles. To be more humane, NotePad K10 Tablet features Eye-Care mode, which automatically adjusts and optimizes the backlight. It makes you read comfortably at night.

[Ultimate Entertainment Experience]: The NotePad K10 Tablet comes with dual speakers, providing a robust audio experience for your favorite music, videos, and games. Besides, Dual-Wi-Fi mode provides two choices for network-2.4GHz & 5GHz. With high-speed network connections, you can feel free to browse, video chat, play games, watch movies or TV series, and so on.

[Sturdy Design, Large Storage]: The Dragon Touch NotePad K10 Tablet has a simple but also not simple design. The fashion, line-clear and slim metal body look more like artwork. Even so, it still has built-in 32GB storage and supports up to 128G micro SD card to expand the storage. You can download and keep your favorite books, songs, photos, movies, games and everything you like in this slim metal android tablet.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Powerful Performance Dragon Touch NotePad K10 features a 2GB RAM and a 64-bit quad-core processor, offering the smooth performance of playing videos, surfing the Internet, running light games, etc. Android Systerm enhances performance and reduces ads, giving you a more customized experience. Capture Wonderful Moments Dragon Touch NotePad K10 features a rear 8MP camera. Take stunning post-worthy pics or videos whenever you feel inspired, or record memorable moments for birthday party, family get together, etc. The 2-megapixel front camera enables video calling with friends, families who live apart. Store More of Your Moments With 32GB storage, you can store tons of photos, songs, and movies, etc. Plus, Dragon Touch NotePad K10 tablet supports expandable memory by micro SD card up to 128GB. Huge room for everything, from your go-to shows to your favorite memories.

Enjoy 1280*800 IPS Display Dragon Touch NotePad K10 features a brilliant 1280 x 800 Full HD display for richer colors and clarity. It adopts IPS (in-plane-switching) display, a screen technology for liquid-crystal displays (LCDs), which easily display more details in 1080P@60fps video, web pages, and colorful pictures. You are able to enjoy widescreen movies, videos, and games with wide viewing angles, less glare, and more brightness. Multi-Functions to Explore Dragon Touch NotePad K10 has many other functions for you to explore. With built-in Google Assistant, you can quickly get answers, take calls, play a song, check the temperature, control smart devices and more. With a micro HDMI port, you can easily connect your tablet into any TV and start streaming your favorite content. An integrated GPS sensor makes navigation possible when you download an offline map to the tablet. Are you a radio lover? The K10 tablet is also equipped with FM radio. Last Longer for More With 5000mAh battery and Smart Power-Saving technology, Dragon Touch NotePad K10 allows you to enjoy entertainment and gaming for over 10 hours. It also features a 5V/2A micro USB power adapter. When watching movies/TV shows, playing games with the high-speed network(2.4GHz/5GHz Dual WiFi Mode), you needn’t worry about a power cut.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great 10" tablet for the price.
reviews.reviewText: I've used it for a few days now, and I'm really pleased with it so far. Seems to be stock Android 10, which I really appreciate. Very responsive touchscreen, and runs apps smoothly. I've tried a few games on it, and it works well. It isn't quite up to 2020 flagship performance, but it seems run games similarly to my old LG G6, which is perfectly acceptable for a budget tablet. I even tried COD mobile, and while it would only do "low" quality settings, it was fully playable. The screen is clear and bright, and works well with Netflix, YouTube, Disney+, and other streaming video services I've tried. It may not be 1080p, but you could've fooled me. The absolute best feature though is the strength of the Wi-Fi. It is far above every other budget tablet I've ever used, and has never lost connection. The only negative I've found so far is that the cameras are really subpar. The front camera is usable for something like a zoom call, but it's pretty grainy, and needs a lot of light in the room. The rear camera is a little better, but not by much. I would have preferred that they put a higher megapixel camera on the front, even if they excluded the rear camera entirely. Overall though, it exceeded expectations at this price point in every area that matters to me, so I'm really liking it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value, Really Nice Product
reviews.reviewText: I needed to replace a used Nexium a friend gave me when it finally bit the dust. I really wanted an Android as they are more intuitively obvious for me than a Kindle and significantly less expensive that an Apple device.Without a lot of money to spend, I decided to try the Dragon. I've had it for a few months and am absolutely very happy with it. It has everything I want and without the bloat-ware. And for those things I don't want (I don't do games for example) they are easy to be removed.Thus far the battery works great and I don't see any degradation of any sort though it has only been two months. It's large enough for great reading and watching videos yet is not clunky or heavy.It's not so much the average rating but the percent of 1 and 2 reviews. VERY low, and some of which are not about the device. Nicely done Dragon! If someone needs a device I will recommend they look. If I need another I probably won't do much shopping around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
reviews.reviewText: The tablet looks beautiful and sleek with the brushed titanium back panel and minimal camera. The tablet comes with a headphone jack and SIM card slot, which is a great plus when I needed to access my old phone number. The tablet also includes a keyboard slot which makes it a versatile notebook.The tablet's has dual speakers. however, the tablet doesn't have strong bass but the audio quality is beyond my expectations from other tablets I've seen so far.The screen quality is bright with plenty of options of contrasts, such as grayscale for reading, and eye comfort to reduce eye strain. The OS also includes a greatly-designed dark theme. The touch screen is not highly reactive so I don't have to worry about scratches or thumbprint stains.The battery life is comfortably long for general purpose.Overall the tablet is fast and built high quality and would definitely buy it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: Overall verdict after 1 month of use: Very reasonably priced, with a professional enough look and feel that it doesn't feel like a kids' device, but has a couple flaws that probably were inevitable at this price point.I was looking for an inexpensive tablet as a reading device (while wanting more flexibility than a dedicated ebook reader) and saw this tablet mentioned in a comment on an online article about "best tablets" as a suggestion for a gem that was missing from the list. I wanted to avoid Kindle and upon looking this up it seemed to be a very reasonably priced alternative, and got good enough reviews so I decided to go for it.The tablet seems mostly well-constructed. The back is brushed aluminum which isn't necessarily my favorite look (would have preferred either a smooth silver finish or colored aluminum options) but the metal body makes it feel a little more high end and not so plasticky. The charging port is basically my one complaint with the construction, as the USB C port seems kinda... wobbly? The cable can be wiggled around when it's plugged in which makes me a bit nervous to damage the device. This happens with both the cable that came with the tablet as well as a higher end USB C cable I bought previously for a different device, so it is definitely the tablet's fault and not the cable.The screen is fine, I have no idea what the description means by "2.5D curved screen" as the screen seems flat to me, but the color/contrast seems fine (and can be lightly adjusted in the system settings) and the touch response is good so no complaints. The 1280x800px resolution does feel kinda low for a 10in device (Kindle Fire 10 has 1080p and even most cellphones nowadays get higher resolution than this on much smaller screens), but this is a very inexpensive tablet so I can't really be too upset.On the software side, the operating system support is a little out of date and the tablet is a little bit laggy on some operations, but nothing unbearable. Android 10 is still popular and development supported and generally fine to use, but at the time I purchased the tablet (February 2021) the operating system was already a year and a half old and a whole major version behind, which might cause some issues in the long run with software support. The device does not seem to support updating to Android 11 and certainly not to the upcoming Android 12.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased several Dragon Touch tablets for my business as a band leader over the past 5 years. The display is bright and easy to read onstage. I recommended you purchase a glare filtering screen cover to cut down on the reflection from stage lighting, but these are available on Amazon for a good price. The new 64 gig DragonTouch K10 is a great replacement for the 16 gig I bought four years ago. Four times the data storage for only a a few dollars more.
